Ask HN: How large a portion of your team's cloud bill is caused by databases?
text: I'm consulting with a team where the database costs comprise ~90% of the entire cloud bill. This seems like a ridiculous ratio, but I haven't had access to such billing information before. Is it common for database costs to balloon like this? I wouldn't consider the team's treatment of the database to be good, but this cost is insane. Have you experienced anything similar, and how do you even go about optimizing a database that's been driven into the ground?

Show HN: GitHub Commit Visualiser
text:
I built a tool which you can use to visualise your git commits at an org or repository level. It shows just how much work an engineering team, or even an individual does, that often goes unseen by non-dev teams.

You can read about the build here: https://ably.com/blog/visualize-your-commits-in-realtime-wit...

Repo is here: https://github.com/ably-labs/github-commit-visualizer

You can deploy your own to netlify (or provider of your choice) and start visualising your own project's commits in realtime.
